comment: He tries to make class entertaining . frequent guest speakers . really enjoyed the class, it was enlightening and helpful for my first year at KSU. He's a really nice professor. Do your work, take notes , attend class and you'll pass!

Dr. Gross has definitely made an impact on my perspective of our world today. KSU 1111 with Dr. Gross has a very laid back environment. There's one test (midterm) and he gives you the option at a final exam or a final paper. If you want an A do the DRJs he assigns those are easy 100s. Overall Dr. Gross is an amazing instructor! TAKE HIM!

Great teacher overall, he is well aware of our generation and is able to relate to the things students go through when in college. He is serious when needs to be and fun when it is a right time. Easy going everything is literally in the syllabus if not he will make up for the confusion. Definitely a professor I can see myself keeping contact with!

VERY helpful and friendly. Made you feel involved. Class discussions MATTER so show up to class! A lot of group projectsassignments. Guest speakers every other week. The studyguides are vague so make sure to stay for the optional review session! Very insightful class and really made you think as an adultcontributor to society

Dr. Gross has a refreshing personality. He is willing to work with students, and he is a very likable person. As one of my first college courses, I became fully comfortable in his class. After all, he is the Director of Orientation and Transition Programs. He likes doing group discussions and assignments. Reading is recommended. Interesting class.

Dr. Gross was the best professor I had this semester. It isn't just a sit down, listen to him talk class, but a interactive class where we just talked about things most class period. He's super helpful with letting people know about all the campus events going on, and cares about student success. If you have a chance to take him, do it.
Really liked him.  Brought in donuts and candy last day of class and gives really good feedback on presentations.  Daily reflection journals are a hassle but overall I'd recommend him.
